_comment: Created by NCODowd on 16/11/2016 17:22:46 using v2.7
title: How have the numbers of nurses in psychiatric services changed?
analysis_commentary:
Similar to the number of nurses in community services the numbers of nurses in psychiatric services also do not follow the same overall pattern for all qualified nursing, midwifery and health visiting staff.

There has been a steady decline in the number of non-community psychiatric nurses (other psychiatry) between September 2009 and July 2016, from 25,341 to 19,170; this represents a 24% decrease. The number of community psychiatric nurses has remained steady, increasing slightly in 2016.

Updated November 2016
